intro: Eustegia fraterna var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy eustegia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are ovate with a pubescent surface, and it produces showy, pale yellow or white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
